H0.text: A change in phase is the best description of the heat and noise generated from the lawnmower when Dennis operates it and notices the engine makes a lot of noise and becomes very hot.

H1.text: Thermal expansion is the best description of the heat and noise generated by the lawnmower when Dennis operates it, noting the engine makes a lot of noise and becomes very hot.

H2.text: An increase in entropy describes the heat and noise generated from Dennis’s lawnmower when he operates it, as the engine makes a lot of noise and gets very hot.

H3.text: Mechanical advantage best describes the heat and noise generated from Dennis’s lawnmower, which makes a lot of noise and gets very hot when he operates it.

A4.text: The second law of thermodynamics states that entropy in an isolated system increases during all spontaneous chemical and physical processes.

A5.text: Heat could be created by friction, as when cannon bores are machined.
